page.title: 03Farming - Land
page.content: The land surrounding Comber is less than 200ft above sea level.About half is undulating with little hills called drumlins.The other half is flat, reclaimed land.The soil is very fertile and there is light rainfall and high sunshine average which makesthe area very suitable for market gardening.Most farmers specialise in potatoes,vegatables and some barley crops.They supply the local markets with their vegatables and also the city of Belfast. There are a few dairy farms and some sheep grazing on higher ground but this type of farming is not so significant. Farmers are now employing fewer labourers since they have become more mechanised.They are annoyed by the increasing burden of clerical work and government restrictions.
